bill.title: Allowing the transfer upon death and providing for an income tax deduction for contributions to an ABLE account and conforming allowable expenses for 529 plans to federal law.
bill.description: Allowing the transfer upon death and providing for an income tax deduction for contributions to an ABLE account and conforming allowable expenses for 529 plans to federal law.

history.action: House Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Insurance
House Hearing: Thursday, January 26, 2017, 09:00 AM Room 281-N
House Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Insurance
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
House Engrossed on Wednesday, February 8, 2017
House Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 85 Nay: 38
Senate Received and Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Financial Institutions and Insurance
Senate Hearing: Wednesday, March 15, 2017, 09:30 AM Room 546-S
Senate Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Financial Institutions and Insurance
Senate Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
Senate Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 38 Nay: 2
House Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Representative Vickrey , Representative Dove and Representative Neighbor as conferees
Senate Motion to accede adopted;  Senator Longbine,  Senator Billinger and  Senator Rogers appointed as conferees
Senate  Senator Tyson,  Senator Kerschen, and  Senator Holland are appointed to replace  Senator Longbine,  Senator Billinger, and  Senator Rogers on the Conference Committee

House  Representative Johnson,  Representative Phillips, and  Representative Sawyer are appointed to replace  Representative Vickrey,  Representative Dove, and  Representative Neighbor on the Conference Committee
Senate Conference committee report now available
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Conference Committee Report not adopted;  Yea: 18 Nay: 22
Senate Motion to Reconsider Adopted
Senate Conference Committee Report not adopted;  Senator Tyson,  Senator Kerschen and  Senator Holland appointed as second conferees
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Motion to accede adopted;  Representative Johnson,  Representative Phillips and  Representative Sawyer appointed as second conferees
Senate Conference committee report now available
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 26 Nay: 14
House Conference Committee Report not adopted;  Yea: 37 Nay: 85
House Motion to Reconsider Adopted
House Conference Committee Report not adopted;  Representative Johnson,  Representative Phillips and  Representative Sawyer appointed as third conferees
Senate Motion to accede adopted;  Senator Tyson,  Senator Kerschen and  Senator Holland appointed as third conferees
Senate Conference committee report now available
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 40 Nay: 0
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 120 Nay: 1
House Reengrossed on Thursday, May 3, 2018
House Enrolled and presented to Governor on Tuesday, May 08, 2018
House Approved by Governor on Thursday, May 17, 2018

votes.desc: House Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 85 Nay: 38
Senate Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 38 Nay: 2
Senate Conference Committee Report not adopted - Yea: 18 Nay: 22
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 26 Nay: 14
House Conference Committee Report not adopted - Yea: 37 Nay: 85
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 40 Nay: 0
House Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 120 Nay: 1

calendar.description: Senate Financial Institutions and Insurance Hearing
